group_1.textLeft: Why are you...talking?
More importantly, you can help me with my@problems...?

group_1.textRight: If you become a Magical Gi— well, no,@that's not what they call it here...
If you become a Diviner, I can grant your wish.

group_1.textLeft: What would happen if I wished for my parents'@worries to disappear?

group_1.textRight: It would come true, of course.
But which worries would you like to get rid of?
From what I know, people worry about all kinds of@things.
It might not turn out the way you hope.

group_1.textLeft: ...I just want my mom and dad to go back to normal,
and the worries they're having right now are getting@in the way of that.
And since all of those concerns surely involve me...
Then, please—
Please erase the worries that my parents have@with me!

group_1.narration: ...That was my wish, and how I became a Diviner.
At first,@my parents were shocked I became one, but...
Somehow, they managed to grasp the situation,@and went back to the way they were before...@to the parents that I knew and loved.

group_1.textRight: Okay, I'll be a little late coming home today, but...
You can handle things on your own, right?

group_1.textLeft: Of course I can!@You worry too much.

group_1.textRight: You're right...sorry about that!
I'm off!

group_1.textLeft: Yes!

group_1.narration: I found peace again,@and lived happily with my beloved parents.

group_1.textLeft: A-ahhh...Sunao...

group_1.textRight: Shouldn't you two be going to bed?

group_1.textLeft: Well...your mother and I have something important@to discuss.

group_1.textRight: Really...?

group_1.narration: Before I knew it, they were both@up to their necks in fear again.
And then, I found out why.

group_1.textRight: I can't stand this...I'm so terrified knowing my@daughter is fighting Devils...

group_1.textLeft: Ahh...I can't believe this is happening...

group_1.narration: I thought I should never have@made my wish to begin with...

group_1.textRight: Only later did I learn about the Tokime's traditions,
and that my parents had been praying I would never@become a Diviner.

group_1.textLeft: So that's why they kept asking you...
...if you had anything you were worrying about or having trouble with...
So that you, since you didn't know anything about@the Tokime Clan, wouldn't wish for it on your own.

group_1.textRight: And yet I did.
Through my wish, I was able to erase their fears@about me becoming a Diviner,
and that also temporarily restored my old@relationship with my parents.
But that only led them to worrying about other@things.
It's all because of my wish.
Ever since then, my parents have become@overprotective.
They're more worried about me than ever before.
Whenever I try to do something or go somewhere,
they'll interrogate me about who I'm meeting or@where I'll be going.
I'm certain they're afraid that I'll somehow ruin@things again.

group_1.textLeft: I wouldn't put it like that...
Maybe it's more like, because of all the stuff that@happened,
your parents are just asking to be on the safe side?
They let you go to the product exhibition, after all.

group_1.textRight: Yes, but they're still coming here to check on me.

group_1.textLeft: Umm...yeah, but...

group_1.textRight: In truth, I did want to talk to them the way Shizuka@suggested,
and tell them I'll be all right and that they don't have@to come.
But I don't think they'd be satisfied if I said that.
And as for Kamihama,
I know my parents will lose their minds if they find@out what we've been doing.

group_1.textLeft: ...What will you do, then?

group_1.textRight: Huh?

group_1.textLeft: You know you can't keep going on like this,@don't you?
After what happened in the past,
I don't want my parents to be worried about me.
Won't you feel guilty if you don't tell them about@Kamihama?

group_1.textRight: But...what am I supposed to do?

group_1.textLeft: I think the only way out is by earning their trust.
So tomorrow, we need to be in top form at the@product exhibition.
If we want your parents to realize they don't have@anything to worry about,
we'll have to show them what you— or rather,@we— can do!

group_1.textCenter: Is there someone else out there who's made the@same wish as I have...?
